title: These Air Jordan sneakers won NBA All-Star Weekend | GQ India | Look Good | Style & Fashion

text:
Style & Fashion These Air Jordan sneakers won NBA All-Star Weekend He might not have played, but that doesn't mean Jordan couldn't be the star of ASW once again 0 Feb 22, 2017 Alex Reside He might not be playing, but that doesn’t mean Jordan can’t be the star of ASW once again. 
Michael Jordan lit up NBA All-Star Weekends with dazzling performances in 13 games over his career, three of which earned him MVP awards and the Bulls great walked away with Slam Dunk Content victories, in 1987 and ’88. (Who could forget MJ’s iconic free throw line dunk ?) To honor his Airness’s greatness during his epic ASW run, Jordan Brand is releasing a brand spanking-new Air Jordan 1 style timed to this weekend’s All-Star Weekend in New Orleans. 
Dubbed the “Air Jordan 1 High All-Star”, the high top is inspired by MJ’s 1982 NCAA National Championship victory (which just happened to take place in New Orleans as well.) It’s alluded to in the kicks’ vamp, ankle, and heel, where iridescent blue details call to mind both Jordan’s North Carolina uniform and the plastic-y sheen of Mardi Gras beads. That’s counter-balanced by a high-contrast black-and-white upper and white sidewall. The overall effect is very business up front, party in the back (it helps the silhouette in play here is the Jordan 1, a.k.a. the most wearable and minimal of any Jordan silhouette). 
Plenty of other brands are rolling out a slew of souped-up kicks this week to capitalize on the annual gathering of the NBA’s biggest talents. These Air Jordan 1 High All-Stars are hardly attention-seeking compared to the competition. Onlookers might not even realize there’s anything new or special about the classic kicks before you’re walking away—and that’s what makes them worth hunting down. It’s the kind of special release that’s actually wearable, able to sit under jeans or chinos or sweats without overpowering the rest of your outfit. In that way, this pair is a fitting tribute to the legend. After all, MJ always knew that All-Star Weekend was a time for bringing your A-game, even among the best of the best. 
Get yours at nike.com
